text: The Professorship of Mineralogy was a professorship at the University of Cambridge. It was founded in 1808 and discontinued when its final holder retired in 1931. It was replaced by the Professorship of Mineralogy and Petrology. ==Professors of Mineralogy== * Edward Daniel Clarke (1808) * John Stevens Henslow (1822) * William Whewell (1828) * William Hallowes Miller (1832) * William James Lewis (1881) * Arthur Hutchinson (1926-1931) ==References== Category:Professorships at the University of Cambridge Category:Department of Earth Sciences, University of Cambridge Category:1808 establishments in England
title: Professor of Mineralogy (Cambridge)
